content.label: Principal investigator
content.name: principle_investigator
content.description: Please specify the person / laboratory responsible for the data acquisition.

content.label: Institution
content.name: institution
content.description: Please specify the institution where the data was acquired.

content.label: Corresponding Email
content.name: corresponding_email
content.description: To whom correspondence should be addressed?

content.label: Is the workflow targeted or untargeted?
content.name: workflow_targeted
content.description: Targeted workflows are typically based on Single Ion Monitoring (SIM) or Selected Reaction Monitoring (SRM). Workflows based on scans are considered untargeted.

content.label: Clinical
content.name: clinical
content.description: Clinical lipidomics refers to studies on human samples using a quantitative and validated method. It refers not only to studies using a clinical diagnostic method, but also to studies aimed at developing and validating lipids for clinical applications.

content.label: Extraction method
content.name: extraction_method
content.description: Which type of lipid extraction was applied?

content.label: Other extraction method
content.name: other_extraction_method
content.description: Which other extraction method was applied? Please provide a PubMed identifier or DOI, if available.

content.name: other_ph_adjustment
content.description: Which other pH adjustment was applied?

content.name: polarity_mode
content.description: Which polarity was applied for analysis?

content.name: type_pos_ion
content.description: This is a generic list and NOT filtered with respect to the lipid class

content.label: Type of negative (precursor)ion
content.name: type_neg_ion
content.description: This is a generic list and NOT filtered with respect to the lipid class

content.label: Other type of positive (precursor)ion
content.name: other_pos_ion
content.description: Which other type of (precursor)ion?

content.name: other_neg_ion
content.description: Which other type of (precursor)ion?

content.label: Fragments for identification
content.name: frag_used
content.description: Please specify the fragments used for the identification. The suggested fragment ions are following this standard nomenclature: (doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0188394)

content.label: Isotope correction at MS1
content.name: isotope_corr_ms1
content.description: Type II isotopic overlap occurs in DB series, i.e. within a lipid class the M + 2 isotopologue of an unsaturated species overlaps the M + 0 of species with one less double bond. See https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jlr.2021.100138.

content.label: Isotope correction at MS2
content.name: isotope_corr_ms2
content.description: Was Type II overlap corrected?

content.label: Isotope correction at MSn
content.name: isotope_corr_msn
content.description: Was Type II overlap corrected?

content.label: MS1 verified by standard
content.name: ms1_verified
content.description: Were standards used to check which ions are formed for the lipid class?

content.label: MS2 verified by standard
content.name: ms2_verified
content.description: Were standards used to check which product ions are formed for the lipid class?

content.label: MSn verified by standard
content.name: msn_verified
content.description: Were standards used to check which product ions are formed for the lipid class?

content.label: Background check at MS1
content.name: bgcheck_ms1
content.description: Was checked whether background ions interfere ?

content.label: Background check at MS2
content.name: bgcheck_ms2
content.description: Was checked whether background ions interfere?

content.label: Background check at MSn
content.name: bgcheck_msn
content.description: Was checked whether background ions interfere?

content.label: Did you presume assumptions for identification?
content.name: assumptions
content.description: Assumptions for instance can be: only even chain fatty acyl chains.

choice.name: general_checks#isomer_overlap
choice.label: Isomeric overlap
choice.description: Was interference by isomeric lipid classes excluded, see LSI table?

content.name: lod

content.description: Was separation of isobaric/isomeric interferece confirmed by primary standards?

content.name: model_for_separation_prediction
content.description: Was a model used to predict lipid molecule separation?

content.name: additional_dimension
content.description: Were additional analytical dimensions applied?

content.name: ccs_verified_by_standard
content.description: Were standards used to check collision cross section (CCS) values?

content.name: other_additional_dimension
content.description: Which other additional dimension/technique was used?

content.name: add_dim_used
content.description: For example: For separation of isobaric/isomeric interferece

content.label: Was a model used to predict lipid molecule separation?
content.name: model_predicted
content.description: Models can be for instance a collision cross section (CCS) model

content.name: other_ident_soft
content.description: Which other lipid identification software was used?

content.description: Which kind of data manipulation was applied?

content.name: other_data_manipul
content.description: Which other data manipulation was applied?

content.name: nomenclature_molecule
content.description: Was the latest shorthand notation (doi: 10.1194/jlr.S120001025) used for annotation?

content.label: Nomenclature for fragment ions
content.name: nomenclature_frag
content.description: Was the recommended annotation of fragment ions (doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0188394) applied?

content.label: Further identification remarks
content.name: ident_remarks
content.description: Do you have further remarks considering the identification?

content.label: Quantitative
content.name: quantitative
content.description: Is the lipid quantitatively identified, i.e. concentrations are reported?

content.label: MS Level for quantification
content.name: ms_level_quant
content.description: Which MS level(s) was(were) used for quantification?

content.label: Internal lipid standard(s) MS1
content.name: internal_standard_ms1
content.description: Which internal standard(s) was/were used to quantify which endogenous lipid/lipid subclass? Example: Cer 18:1;O2/12:0 for all Cer 18:1;O2/XX:X

content.label: Internal lipid standard(s) MS2
content.name: internal_standard_ms2
content.description: Which internal standard(s) was/were used with which fragment(s) to quantify which endogenous lipid/lipid subclass? Example: Cer 18:1;O2/12:0 with fragment LCB-H2O3 for all Cer 18:1;O2/XX:X

content.label: Type of quantification
content.name: type_of_quant
content.description: How were the samples quantified?

content.label: Other type of quantification
content.name: other_type_of_quant
content.description: Which other type of quantification was used?

content.label: Type of calibration line
content.name: type_calib
content.description: Which type of calibration was used?

content.label: Species calibration line
content.name: species_calibration_line
content.description: Which lipid species were used for the calibrations?

content.label: Response correction
content.name: response_corr
content.description: Was the analytical response of individual lipid species corrected?

content.label: Type I isotope correction
content.name: type_i_corr
content.description: Type I isotopic effect refers to the fact that the abundance (normalized to the sum of all isotopologues) of M+0 decreases and higher isotopologues increase with the number of carbon atoms.Was isotopic abundance of individual species corrected (Type I)?

content.label: Limit of quantification
content.name: loq
content.description: Was limit of quantification applied?

content.label: Other limit of quantification
content.name: other_loq
content.description: Which other limit of quantification was applied?

content.label: Normalization to reference
content.name: norm_ref
content.description: Was a normalization applied to a reference?

content.label: Lipid Quantification Software
content.name: quant_soft
content.description: Which software was used for quantification?

content.label: Other Lipid Quantification Software
content.name: other_quant_soft
content.description: Which other software was used for quantification?

content.label: Batch correction
content.name: batch_corr
content.description: Was a batch correction applied?

content.label: Other Batch correction
content.name: other_batch_corr
content.description: Which other batch correction was applied?

content.label: Further quantification remarks
content.name: quant_remarks
content.description: Do you have further remarks considering the quantification?
